conclusion: Analyze the path of the light beam and apply Snell's Law to find the refractive index.
Given radius R, distance from P to AC is sqrt(3)R/2, MC is sqrt(3)R/3.
Determine coordinates of P as (R/2, sqrt(3)R/2).
Calculate slope from P to M as -sqrt(3) and angle of incidence theta_i as 60 degrees.
Apply Snell's Law: n sin(theta_i) = sin(theta_r).
Calculate slope from B to M and determine tan(theta_r).
Approximate sin(theta_r) using small angle approximation.
Final refractive index n is sqrt(3).
